intro: Eriocaulon pilosissimum, commonly known as the silky spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and slender, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, pale flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wetland environments such as marshes and swamps. The plant has hairy leaves and stems, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Its botanical structure is adapted to waterlogged soils, with rhizomes that help in anchoring and nutrient absorption.
